Automata.NFADFA

Class CDFA

  • java.lang.Object
    • Automata.NFADFA.CFA
      • Automata.NFADFA.CDFA
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IDFA, INFA

    public class CDFA
extends CFA
implements IDFA
    The CDFA class is an implementation of the abstract CFA class. It provides methods for building a DFA.

      • CDFA

        public CDFA(int aStartState,
            Alphabet aAlphabet,
            StateSet aFinalStates,
            StateSet aInitialStates,
            java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> aOutput,
            int aStateCount,
            int[][] aTable,
            int aErrorState,
            java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> aNFAStates,
            java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> aSymbols)
        Creates a new DFA with the specified components.
        Parameters:
        aStartState - the start state
        aAlphabet - the set of input Alphabet
        aFinalStates - the set of final states
        aInitialStates - the set of initial states.
        aOutput -
        aStateCount - the total number of states
        aTable - A transition table which is a mapping from states and input symbols to other states.
        aErrorState - the error state
        aNFAStates - the set of NFA-states
        aSymbols - a string-list of input symbols.
